informal_statement: A ring \( R \) has \((A_n)\) if each ideal \( I \subseteq Z(R) \) that can be generated by \( n \) (or fewer) elements has a nonzero annihilator. An alternate restriction on zero divisors is \((a.c.)\): \( R \) has \((a.c.)\) if for each pair of elements \( r, s \in R \), there is an element \( t \in R \) such that \( 	ext{Ann}(r, s) = 	ext{Ann}(t) \).There does not exist a reduced ring that have both \((a.c.)\) and \((A_n)\) for some \( n \geq 2 \) that are not McCoy rings.
formal_statement:
def zeroDivisors (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Set R :=
  {x : R | ∃ (y : R), x * y = 0 ∧ y ≠ 0}

/--
A commutative ring \( R \) is said to be a \textit{McCoy ring} if each finitely generated ideal \( I \subseteq Z(R) \) (where \( Z(R) \) denotes the set of zero divisors of \( R \)) has a nonzero annihilator.
-/
class IsMcCoy (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Prop where
  isMcCoy : ∀ (I : Ideal R), I ≤ zeroDivisors R → I.FG → I.annihilator ≠ ⊥

/--
A ring \( R \) has \((A_n)\) if each ideal \( I \subseteq Z(R) \) that can be generated by \( n \) (or fewer) elements has a nonzero annihilator.
-/
def A (n : ℕ) (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Prop := ∀ (I : Ideal R), I ≤  zeroDivisors R → (∃ S : Finset R, S.card ≤ n ∧ Ideal.span S = I) → I.annihilator ≠ ⊥

/--
An alternate restriction on zero divisors is \((a.c.)\): \( R \) has \((a.c.)\) if for each pair of elements \( r, s \in R \), there is an element \( t \in R \) such that \( \text{Ann}(r, s) = \text{Ann}(t) \).
-/
def AC (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Prop := ∀ (r s : R), ∃ (t : R), (Ideal.span {r, s}).annihilator = (Ideal.span {t}).annihilator


theorem isMcCoy_of_a_of_ac (n : ℕ) (R : Type) [CommRing R] (hn : 2 ≤ n) [IsReduced R] (hA : A n R) (hAC : AC R) : IsMcCoy R := by
informal_prefix:
/--
There does not exist a reduced ring that have both \((a.c.)\) and \((A_n)\) for some \( n \geq 2 \) that are not McCoy rings.
-/
name: conjecture_5B

informal_statement: A ring \( R \) has \((A_n)\) if each ideal \( I \subseteq Z(R) \) that can be generated by \( n \) (or fewer) elements has a nonzero annihilator. An alternate restriction on zero divisors is \((a.c.)\): \( R \) has \((a.c.)\) if for each pair of elements \( r, s \in R \), there is an element \( t \in R \) such that \( 	ext{Ann}(r, s) = 	ext{Ann}(t) \). There exists a reduced ring that have both \((a.c.)\) and \((A_n)\) for some \( n \geq 2 \) that are not McCoy rings.
formal_statement:
def zeroDivisors (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Set R :=
  {x : R | ∃ (y : R), x * y = 0 ∧ y ≠ 0}

/--
A commutative ring \( R \) is said to be a \textit{McCoy ring} if each finitely generated ideal \( I \subseteq Z(R) \) (where \( Z(R) \) denotes the set of zero divisors of \( R \)) has a nonzero annihilator.
-/
class IsMcCoy (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Prop where
  isMcCoy : ∀ (I : Ideal R), I ≤ zeroDivisors R → I.FG → I.annihilator ≠ ⊥

/--
A ring \( R \) has \((A_n)\) if each ideal \( I \subseteq Z(R) \) that can be generated by \( n \) (or fewer) elements has a nonzero annihilator.
-/
def A (n : ℕ) (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Prop := ∀ (I : Ideal R), I ≤  zeroDivisors R → (∃ S : Finset R, S.card ≤ n ∧ Ideal.span S = I) → I.annihilator ≠ ⊥

/--
An alternate restriction on zero divisors is \((a.c.)\): \( R \) has \((a.c.)\) if for each pair of elements \( r, s \in R \), there is an element \( t \in R \) such that \( \text{Ann}(r, s) = \text{Ann}(t) \).
-/
def AC (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Prop := ∀ (r s : R), ∃ (t : R), (Ideal.span {r, s}).annihilator = (Ideal.span {t}).annihilator


theorem exists_a_and_ac_and_not_isMcCoy : ∃ (n : ℕ) (R : Type) (_ : CommRing R), 2 ≤ n ∧ IsReduced R ∧ A n R ∧ AC R ∧ ¬ IsMcCoy R := by
informal_prefix:
/--
There exists a reduced ring that have both \((a.c.)\) and \((A_n)\) for some \( n \geq 2 \) that are not McCoy rings.
-/
name: conjecture_5A

informal_statement: There exists an integrally closed reduced ring \( R \) such that \( R_M \) is an integrally closed McCoy ring for each maximal ideal \( M \), but \( R \) is not a McCoy ring and it is not locally a domain.
formal_statement:
def zeroDivisors (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Set R :=
  {x : R | ∃ (y : R), x * y = 0 ∧ y ≠ 0}

/--
A commutative ring \( R \) is said to be a \textit{McCoy ring} if each finitely generated ideal \( I \subseteq Z(R) \) (where \( Z(R) \) denotes the set of zero divisors of \( R \)) has a nonzero annihilator.
-/
class IsMcCoy (R : Type) [CommRing R] : Prop where
  isMcCoy : ∀ (I : Ideal R), I ≤  zeroDivisors R → I.FG → I.annihilator ≠ ⊥


theorem exists_not_isMcCoy_and_not_isDomain_atPrime : ∃ (R : Type) (_ : CommRing R), IsIntegrallyClosed R ∧ IsReduced R ∧ (∀ m : MaximalSpectrum R, IsIntegrallyClosed (Localization.AtPrime m.asIdeal) ∧ IsMcCoy (Localization.AtPrime m.asIdeal)) ∧ ¬ IsMcCoy R ∧ ∃ (m : MaximalSpectrum R), ¬ IsDomain (Localization.AtPrime m.asIdeal) := by
informal_prefix:
/--
There exists an integrally closed reduced ring \( R \) such that \( R_M \) is an integrally closed McCoy ring for each maximal ideal \( M \), but \( R \) is not a McCoy ring and it is not locally a domain.
-/
name: conjecture_4A

informal_statement: Let $k$ be a field, $A$ be a finite dimensional (not necessarily commutative) $k$-algebra. Prove that there exists a integer $d$, such that for every $A$-module $M$ that has $M$ has finite projective dimension, then the projective dimension of $M$ is less than or equal to $d$.
formal_statement:
theorem hasProjectiveDimensionLE_bounded {k A : Type} [Field k] [Ring A] [Algebra k A] [FiniteDimensional k A] :
    ∃ (d : ℕ), ∀ (M : Type) [AddCommGroup M] [Module A M], (∃ u : ℕ, HasProjectiveDimensionLE (ModuleCat.of A M) u) →  CategoryTheory.HasProjectiveDimensionLE (ModuleCat.of A M) d := by
informal_prefix:
/--
Let $k$ be a field, $A$ be a finite dimensional (not necessarily commutative) $k$-algebra.
Prove that there exists a integer $d$, such that for every $A$-module $M$ that has $M$ has finite
projective dimension, then the projective dimension of $M$ is less than or equal to $d$.
-/
name: conjecture_1
